thread.title: School Gives Student Early Graduation Ceremony, So His Dying Dad Can Watch
thread.title_full: School Gives Student Early Graduation Ceremony, So His Dying Dad Can Watch

author: Joshua Espinoza
title: School Gives Student Early Graduation Ceremony, So His Dying Dad Can Watch
text: Subscribe to Complex After being diagnosed with terminal prostate cancer, 68-year-old Alfred La’Cap didn’t think he’d get to see his 17-year-old son graduate from high school. He was told it was unlikely he’d make it to May, which is around the time his youngest son would officially receive his diploma. But thanks to school administrators, Alfred was able to witness the milestone. CNN reports officials at Long Beach High School in Mississippi conducted an early graduation ceremony specifically for Alfred’s son, Noah. School faculty, friends, and family gathered on the La’Cap’s driveway where the small and emotional ceremony took place. Noah was dressed in his red cap and gown, while “Pomp and Circumstance” played through someone’s cellphone. Related
